It should already be fixed in .NET Core 2.0.0.

Here's the pull request: [https://github.com/dotnet/c...](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/12682 "https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/12682")  
Here's the final wrapper as it exists in .NET Core v2: [https://github.com/dotnet/c...](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.IO.Compression/tests/Utilities/WrappedStream.cs "https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.IO.Compression/tests/Utilities/WrappedStream.cs")  
Here's a blog post I wrote about zipping on the fly on .NET Core v1: [https://blog.stephencleary....](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2016/11/streaming-zip-on-aspnet-core.html "https://blog.stephencleary.com/2016/11/streaming-zip-on-aspnet-core.html")  
And here's the code I used to get it working on v1: [https://github.com/StephenC...](https://github.com/StephenClearyExamples/AsyncDynamicZip/tree/core-ziparchive "https://github.com/StephenClearyExamples/AsyncDynamicZip/tree/core-ziparchive")

I'd just recommend using one of those wrappers.
